column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17740](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17740.html) (build: remove configure checks for win libr
Concept ACK

it fails the Travis compile:
```
compiling qwinjumplist.cpp

compiling qwinthumbnailtoolbar.cpp

compiling .moc/release/moc_qwintaskbarprogress.cpp

compiling .moc/release/moc_qwinthumbnailtoolbutton.cpp

compiling qwintaskbarbutton.cpp

qwinjumplist.cpp: In function ‘QString createArguments(const QStringList&)’:

qwinjumplist.cpp:99:66: error: invalid use of incomplete
Or disable qwinjumplist, which this doesn't even use.
I don't understand why gitian succeeds, but not Travis...
Gitian fails for the same reason
Ah, saw win32 builds above, but missed that it was just master...
For now, sed'd out the qwinjumplist stuff since it's completely unused.
@DrahtBot What's the point of the side-by-side when they're not the same on each side?\n\nAnd why did the last build not even attempt?

<!--a722867cd34abeea1fadc8d60700f111-->
### Gitian builds

| File | commit 6a97e8a060f7632bbaee27d3de8035dc6ebe3895 (master) | commit 5d1962100da67257da5fc00b29825c0ccae0cfd6 (master and this pull) |
|--|--|--|
| bitcoin-0.19.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`5c2038572887ff66...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/6a97e8a060f7632bbaee27d3de8035dc6ebe3895/bitcoin-0.19.99-aarch6
@luke-jr How about that table? It might be more readable
Looks much nicer. Might make the .diffs two-column (if markdown supports it)
Concept ACK\nToo bad this requires new dependencies and a bunch of ifdefs
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Concept ~0. I've closed my original issue (#14134), and don't really think that this change and the additional dependencies is really worthwhile.
Closing due to lack of interest
I don't think this is the place to do `setWindow`, every time `setNumBlocks` is called, move it to the initialization maybe?\n
Dunno, this apparently works as-is at least.\n\n(I don't run Windows, so any major changes might be better off with someone else taking over the PR.)
Do you know what is the first release of windows to have `dwmapi`? Is this a recent addition? (if it's windows 7 or older it's fine)
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/dwmapi/nf-dwmapi-dwmsetwindowattribute suggests at least Vista has it.\n
